Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Bishop R.C. Hugh Nelson, D. Min. Lead Pastor/ District Administrative Bishop who serves as a spiritual leader at Church of God of East Flatbush, located at  409 East 95th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11212.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Ampry-Samuel.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Bishop R.C. Hugh Nelson, D. Min. Lead Pastor/ District Administrative Bishop who serves as a spiritual leader at Church of God of East Flatbush, located at 409 East 95th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11212.

Council Member Ampry-Samuel moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: A Local Law to authorize adoption by resolution of an interest rate for nonpayment of taxes on real property with an assessed value over two hundred fifty thousand dollars in fiscal year 2021 for certain property owners adversely affected by COVID-19
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Authorize adoption by resolution of an interest rate for nonpayment of taxes on real property with an assessed value over two hundred fifty thousand dollars in FY'21 for certain property owners adversely affected by COVID-19.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the discount percentage for early payment of real estate taxes be set at one-half of one percent per annum for Fiscal Year 2021.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establish that the discount percentage for early payment of real estate taxes be set at one-half of one percent per annum for FY'21.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate be 18 percent per annum for Fiscal Year 2021 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of over $250,000, or over $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establish that the interest rate be 18 % per annum for FY'21 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of over $250,000, or over $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.

Items.Title: Resolution to establish that the interest rate be 3.25 percent for the first quarter of Fiscal Year 2021 and 5 percent for the remainder of Fiscal Year 2021 for non-payment of taxes on properties with an assessed value of not more than $250,000, or not more than $250,000 per residential unit for cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establish that the interest rate be 3.25 % for the first quarter of FY'21 and 5 % for the remainder of FY'21 for non-payment of taxes on properties.

Items.Title: Resolution to adopt an interest rate of 7.5 percent for a portion of Fiscal Year 2021 for the non-payment of taxes on real property with an assessed value over $250,000 for property owners adversely affected by COVID-19 as authorized by the local law for the year 2020 as proposed in introduction number 1964-A.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Adopt an interest rate of 7.5 % for a portion of FY'21 for the non-payment of taxes on real property with an assessed value over $250,000 for property owners adversely affected by COVID-19.

Items.Title: Resolution to adopt an interest rate of zero percent for a portion of Fiscal Year 2021 for the non-payment of taxes on real property with an assessed value of $250,000 or less for property owners adversely affected by COVID-19 as authorized by the local law for the year 2020 as proposed in introduction number 1974-A.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Adopt an interest rate of zero % for a portion of FY'21 for the non-payment of taxes on real property with an assessed value of $250,000 or less for property owners adversely affected by COVID-19.

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Mr. Williams) presiding as the Acting President Pro Tempore.

The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Mr. Williams).

There were 48 Council Members marked present for this Stated Meeting held remotely.

At the time of this Stated Meeting, there was one vacant seat on the Council in the 37th District (Brooklyn) pending the swearing-in of the certified winner of the November 3, 2020 General Election.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Johnson) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Johnson), the Public Advocate and Acting President Pro Tempore (Mr. Williams) adjourned the meeting.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Mr. Williams) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately (with Council Member Torres considered Present but Not Voting for all the individual votes listed below as well):

Int. No. 1250-A, 39-8-0 - Negative: CMs Cohen, Deutsch, Holden, King, Lancman, Menchaca, Moya, Yeger.

Int. No. 1264-A, 42-5-0 - Negative: CMs Cohen, Deutsch, Holden, King, Yeger.

Int. No. 1266-A, 38-9-0 - Negative: CMs Deutsch, Holden, King, Koo, Lancman, Menchaca, Miller, Moya, Yeger.

Int. No. 1950-A, 46-1-0 - Negative: CM Yeger.

Int. No. 1964-A, 46-1-0  - Negative: CMs Deutsch.

Int. No. 1976, 46-1-0 - Negative: CM Ulrich.

Res. No. 1347, 36-11-0 - Negative: CMs Borelli, Brannan, Deutsch, Diaz, Gjonaj, Holden, King, Koo, Ulrich, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo).

Res. No. 1348, 36-11-0 - Negative: CMs Borelli, Brannan, Deutsch, Diaz, Gjonaj, Holden, King, Koo, Ulrich, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo).

Res. No. 1349, 36-11-0 - Negative: CMs Borelli, Brannan, Deutsch, Diaz, Gjonaj, Holden, King, Koo, Ulrich, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo).


See files for individual votes.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to temporary space for outdoor dining
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Temporary space for outdoor dining.

Items.Title:
Proposed Amendments:

Int. 1964 - STRIKE all references to 7.5% and insert ZERO instead.
Res. 1347 - STRIKE all references to 18% and insert 2% instead.
Res. 1348 - STRIKE all references to 3.25% and 5% and insert ZERO instead.
Res. 1349 - STRIKE all references to 7.5% and insert ZERO instead.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Yeger's Motion to Amend Int. No. 1964-A, Res. Nos. 1347, 1348, and 1349 failed bty a vote of 13-34-0.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by Council Member Yeger to amend Int. No. 1964-A and Res. Nos. 1347, 1348, and 1349 and was Defeated by Council by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Proposed Amendments

Items.MinutesNote:
At this point, Council Member Yeger made a motion to amend the following items:
Int. No. 1964-A, Res. No. 1347, Res. No. 1348, and Res. No. 1349.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
